Using the new raw materials I found on Menelaus, I was able to improve my processors once again, especially with regards to Retium, with its special and quite useful properties in signal transport.

Looking at my previous innovations, my improvements have gotten smaller and smaller. It appears that silicon-based processors have reached the end of their improvable lifespan. To make any drastic improvements, a successor must be found.
Info: For general information, see the standard core.
